description: Borrowed from Middle French discursif, formed from the stem of Latin discursus and the suffix -if, and in part borrowed from Medieval Latin discursivus.

adjectives.description: discursive (comparative more discursive, superlative most discursive)

entries.meaning: (of speech or writing) Tending to digress from the main point; rambling.
(philosophy) Using reason and argument rather than intuition.
